channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: Beginning with Perl and Vagrant (and Ansible)
item.description: 20 min talk with demo showing how to use Vagrant and explaining what is the difference between Vagrant and Docker

item.title: A tale of a Perl start-up
item.description: 20 min video about business and some Perl by Claudiu Campean

item.title: Grep is Losing Its Grip
item.description: A brief summary of three tools you can use instead of grep, when searching through code. Having been a loong-time user of grep, I used ack for a while, but am a big fan of ag at the moment.

item.title: The London Perl Workshop 2016
item.description: My report on this year's London Perl Workshop (LPW).

item.title: meta::hack Wrap-up Report
item.description: Olaf's summary of meta::hack, the recent MetaCPAN hackathon that had a goal of switching over to MetaCPAN v1.

item.title: Taking a couple of steps backwards to fix a GC bug
item.description: Follow along as Jonathan gets into the nitty-gritty of fixing a garbage collection bug in MoarVM. He gets a bonus for saying "less is moar".

item.title: Tips for Perl 6
item.description: While the kickstarter for the Learning Perl 6 book is going on, brian is posting daily short tips about Perl 6.

item.title: Backticks and tests in Perl 6
item.description: Ken works through a script he wrote which does things long considered bread and butter for Perl 5, and shows how he did them in Perl 6.

item.title: 2016.48 Kickstarting Along
item.description: The usual weekly round-up of Perl 5 news.

item.title: Perl 6 Advent
item.description: An advent blog calendar for Perl 6.

item.title: C::Blocks Advent
item.description: David's doing 24 posts about his C::Blocks module, which lets you embed C in your code and have it compiled and run on the fly.

item.title: Command-line modules
item.description: Each day in Advent perlancar is going to describe a different module for parsing command-line arguments.

item.title: Perl 5 advent calendar
item.description: The usual Perl 5 advent calendar is still going strong -- a different Perl module every day.

item.title: Static code analysis with Perl and SonarQube
item.description: Oliver is starting a project to add Perl support to SonarQube, an application which aims to help you manage code quality for your project(s).

item.title: Perl 5 Porters Mailing List Summary: November 21st - 30th
item.description: The one where Sawyer walked out of the shower and the last week and a half turned out to have all been a dream.

item.title: Introducing Net::ACME
item.description: Felipe's new module Net::ACME is an interface to Let's Encrypt's Automatic Certificate Management Environment.

item.title: You can import your Metacpan favorites into perlmodules.net!
item.description: perlmodules.net is a site that tells you when modules you're interested in have changed. You can now import your MetaCPAN favourites.

item.title: Security release - use after free in DBD::mysql when using prepared statements
item.description: A security issue was discovered in DBD::mysql, fixed in version 4.041. If you're using prepared statements with MySQL, update as soon as possible.

item.title: NICEPERL's lists
item.description: Miguel Prz (NICEPERL)'s regular lists: Great modules released last week; MetaCPAN weekly report; StackOverflow Perl report.

item.title: #280 - LPW - 10 years of Mark Keating
item.description:
We just had the London Perl Workshop, the 10th and final one that Mark Keating has organised. He's faced all kind of issues over the years, including serious flooding in his home town last year, but always made sure things ran smoothly. We're all thankful for his work and passion.

It's that time of year again - there are plenty of advent calendars to check every day!

Neil
item.dc:subject: list of tags?
